reviews.review_msg: I got B- in the class, notes are not posted online.  have to read scholarly journals. a lot of assignments and 1 big project. Qualitative project requires a lot of time. she wants you to understand, define and apply relevant qual concepts for your project. textbook references help and are needed.

Dr. Greer is a very kind professor who really values the feedback of her students and makes changes to assignments and deadlines where necessary. Crim 312 is an excellent class that covers important topics- I would highly recommend this course. It was challenging due to multiple (4) writing assignments, but a very rewarding experience overall.

I enjoyed Dr. Greer as a prof! I did an online course with her so I did not get to know her as well as I would've liked, but she made the course very interesting. She provided insightful readings/viewings and we were graded on discussion boards and assignments that allowed you to show your knowledge on an interesting topic.

She is an amazing professor that continuously considers the stress levels and mental health of her students. Active participation through discussion boards is so important in this class. She asks how students are feeling and then accommodates or clarifies concerns throughout the semester. Would definitely take another course with her again.

I would have liked to see more lectures, there were only 2. The level of difficulty was not too hard but definitely not easy. Felt more like a social justice class. There is no textbook but instead weekly modules with required article readings or videos to watch. I liked the format. Was not overwhelming like some classes. Was a pretty good class.
Really enjoyed Alissa's class found it pretty tough with many readings and large written papers. Probably the nicest prof ive ever had. Great class if youre willing to put in work

Overall Awesome Professor. Pretty clear assignment outlines, innovative assignments with a style you probably have not done before. Gets you out of your comfort zone and talking about tough issues. Learned a lot taking the course. Also the TAKE HOME EXAMS are a BONUS!! Have to work for it but it was a rewarding experience!

Dr. Greer is one of the best professors Ive ever had. This class was amazing and not a traditional lecture structure. It actually made you think about social problems in critical and important ways. Ive never taken a class that has made me analyze my beliefs so thoroughly. A very important class. She gives great feedback & clear grading criteria.

I learned quite a lot from Crim 312 and the instructor was very accessible. He responded to feedback, had a good attitude and was very quick with his responses which is something quite rare. I really enjoyed the material covered and learned to write better papers as a result. Highly recommended. Worth the time and money.

Although she tries to describe her grading method, she doesn't follow the same rules.  Don't even get me started on her 'you have to use perfect syntax, punctuation, and spelling' when her weekly modules were littered with obvious mistakes. Phase isn't spelled f-a-s-e, professor! She doesn't care about students and it put me off of Crim.

Most useless TM for distance ever. She was completely absent from any online participation and provided the worst marking scheme I've ever encountered. It's a 3rd year course, and she said I did a great job encorporating my ideas and the reading, but I lost marks cuz I had long paragraphs, or because I used "I" once. Completely Ridiculous - AVOID!!

Farzana takes forever to mark assignments, often going beyond her own deadlines and does not pay close attention to answering emails or posts in TM's Office in a timely manner. Feedback is near non-existent. Lots of reading (100+ pages per week) and writing; guidelines not too clear. If you have a class with her, I'd advise you to drop it.

I'm not sure if she just wasn't interested in the class; but received very little feedback and marks took an average over a month and a half to get back, which was difficult trying to write the next paper. Although I commend her for having in-person office hours- she will make rude comments & tell you she can't help you. Very unapproachable.
